titles: A mournfull elegy upon the three renowned vvorthies Duke Hamilton, the Earle of Holland, and the ever to be honoured Lord Capel, who were tyranically murthered by a usurped illegall power of the wicked court of injustice, and pretended Parliament, upon Friday, the 9. of March, 1649. In the Palace-yard before Westminster-Hall-Gate.
date: Printed in the first Yeare of Rebellious Liberty, and Democraticall Tyranny. 1649.
notes: Verse - "Awake my Muse in sad Elegy,".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Hamilton, James Hamilton, --  Duke of, 1606-1649 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
Holland, Henry Rich, --  Earl of, 1590-1649 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
Capel of Hadham, Arthur Capel, --  Baron, 1610?-1649 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
